posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
Sometimes, someone sais something in a groupchat wich you want to reply to in person rather than in group.

  • Add the option to do this in the options for the selected message.
  • When used, Signal switches view to the private conversation
  • A quote of the message is passed to the private conversation, and added as preview/draft in the compose bar.

It is basicly the same as quotinv a message, the only difference is the jump to an other conversation.
You can already select a message and forward it to someone. You can also select the user in the group chat and open a conversation with them. I’m not sure what else this feature would add.

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
You are completely right. This is kinda covered already. Than all I can say about it is that maybe it would an idea to add a shortcut for this. For example, swipe a message to the right to quote to it in the current chat. Swipe to the right to quote it to a private chat.
Just adding that shortcut.

Just throwing an idea here, as I guess forwarding is indeed so similar that it does not warrant a separate option.

posts.name: Yehuda RIngler
posts.cooked: It is a very natural and common thing to want to do, and would be nice if it was streamlined (as on whatsapp), and it also it gives easier extra context to the one recieveing the message - if someones on multiple groups, they could just click on the message and go back to the group

@Herohtar :
I was searching the feature request for a while to find this one as i expected someone already made this request.

I agree on what you wrote:
Yes, You can forward a message to some one else out of a group chat…

But this does not bring the feature as described by @Meteor0id - what i personally rate as very useful.

What @Meteor0id describes is the function to directly reply on someones post in a group chat on a private basis.
The resulting reply is a message in the private chat between you and the user whose group message you’re replying on. This private message automatically includes a “quoted version” of the users message posted by him in the group chat.
(See Screenshot from WhatsApp on iOS)

This makes it very comfortable and fast to reply privately to someone.
And this is not implemented yet.

Also Telegram dies not have this feature, but is was one of the first features I personally missed after changing from WhatsApp to Signal.

Example from WhatsApp:

image826×727 60.8 KB

image828×885 70.3 KB

This has prevented us migrating a couple of Quizzing groups from Whatsapp. The way it works is the host posts questions to the main group chat and the group members reply by selecting the message (Question) then choose “Reply Privately” - this opens up a chat with the host privately where you type the answer. The host see the original question and the answer. It’s a bit niche but very awkward to achieve in Signal so we moved the groups back to Whatsapp.

posts.name: Almaric78
posts.cooked:
Hello, this feature would be very useful for groups. I often use it in my groups so as not to pollute a debate or discussion, and this allows you to quickly return to the group discussion afterwards with the link cited. Is there a start of a pull request on this with the source code of the change on GitHub?
Thank you so much

posts.name: Alon Bar-Lev
posts.cooked:
Hi,
Per user experience I thought of a long select of reply button to pop up a menu to reply to group or reply privately.
Thanks,

posts.name: Gajanan Aiyer
posts.cooked: Had sent the same suggestion on Apr 25th and was asked to check here in the community. Has this been accepted to be added to a future version?

Unfortunately, the Signal team does not announce which features have been chosen for development. The most advanced notice you’ll get is if some commits show up in the repository and/or it gets announced in the beta program (in which case someone will update the existing feature request thread). If you want this feature, please like the first post in the thread (using the button), and please don’t bump topics asking for status.

posts.name: Jonathan Andreas
posts.cooked:
I searched for this function and couldn’t find it using the standard terminology used in email, but I’m glad it is on the list.
All email programs have the capability to ‘reply’ OR ‘reply all’. This is a basic communication function, so it’s surprising that the functionality has been lost in Signal group chats! Signal could just use the ubiquitous email function icons which are a single arrow for ‘reply privately’ or a double arrow for ‘reply all’. Signal already has a wonderful “reply all” feature, but it is often better to just reply to the sender. In fact, in big group emails, I use “reply to sender” much more frequently than “reply all” to reduce message clutter for the group. Overuse of “reply all” is one of the big problems of email documented in Cal Newport’s book, “A World Without Email”.
Adding both kinds of reply would make Signal chats as effective as email chats!
WhatsApp already has this functionality (called "Reply Privately), but it is much more awkward to use than in email. It would make it easier just add the same kind of arrow icons to the menu and/or add swipe left for “reply to sender” and swipe right for “reply to all”.
Alternatively, we could add a “forward as a quote” function. The current “forward” function is useful, but it is misleadingly named. It should really be called, “copy and broadcast” and “forward” should be the same as the ubiquitous function in emails which quotes the original sender.

link_counts.title: Forward as a quote vs. forward as copying text

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked: Question: could the “reply to story” feature (once it is finalized and stories are released to stable as well) be repurposed for a private reply in group chats? It is already quite similar in that it links to the replied content which is external to the current conversation.

posts.name: MORTAL ENGINE
posts.cooked:
Herohtar:

You can already select a message and forward it to someone. You can also select the user in the group chat and open a conversation with them. I’m not sure what else this feature would add.

There is a difference between forwarding and replying to that fwd message vs replying privately directly. And the difference is ‘ease’. This is much needed feature for Groups.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: It really is. Would be an amazing QoL improvement.

I understand devs often hate to add new features, but none of the workarounds advised here will quote the group message to privately reply to, and :

1 - Forward method is boring (have to search for the recipient)… and we can’t add our own reply (to do this we need to switch to the private conversation then reply… to ourselves
2 - Hitting-the-user-in-the-conversation method requires we first select/copy the message, then use some quoting convention like adding double-quote characters before we paste and send

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: It’s just a matter of priorities. I suspect they’re working hard on usernames and call links. Once they get the huge stuff out of the way they’ll be able to push other stuff.

posts.name: MORTAL ENGINE
posts.cooked: Moreover replying privately directly mentions the message to which you’re replying. It’s much more intuitive too.

posts.name: Delamcode
posts.cooked: I would like to reiterate the purpose of this. Forwarding only copies the message and does not make it clear where it is from nor a way to jump back to it. You’re better off just saying ‘in relation to your comment in the group’, but that also doesn’t work if it’s not a recent message you’re replying to. Even Viber has this feature, and it’s really missing in Signal.
